<h4>Contexte et Objectif</h4>\n<p>Le can:
Context and Objective

Skin cancer can be fatal if not detected early, especially in parts of the world where access to specialized dermatological care is limited. Although dermoscopy-based algorithms have already shown their ability to assist clinicians in diagnosing cancers like melanoma and carcinomas, it is essential to create automated triage systems to determine which individuals should see a specialist.

Project Description

This project involves developing an artificial intelligence algorithm with PyTorch to detect skin cancer early, based on an innovative dataset from the 3D-TBP competition. The goal is to differentiate malignant skin lesions from benign lesions using low-quality images, similar to those captured with mobile phones, to enable use outside of specialized clinical environments.
<h4>Défis techniques</h4>\n<ul>\n <li:
Technical Challenges

  • Image Quality: The images in the dataset simulate those taken with mobile phones, often of lower quality, making the detection challenge more complex.
  • Robust and Flexible Model: The model must be able to adapt to this variability while maintaining high sensitivity for skin cancer detection.
  • Impact on Underserved Populations: By allowing the use of the algorithm in primary care settings or outside clinics, the project aims to extend the benefits of early detection.

Evaluation and Results

The algorithm is evaluated using the ROC (Receiver Operating Characteristic) curve, focusing on the partial area under the curve (pAUC) for true positive rates (TPR) above 80%. This measure ensures that the algorithm is sufficiently sensitive to detect malignant lesions in a clinical context.

Technologies Used

  • PyTorch: For building and training deep learning models.
  • OpenCV: For image preprocessing.
  • Scikit-learn: For evaluation metrics and result analysis.
  • Pandas and NumPy: For data management and manipulation.
<h4>Description du Projet</h4>\n<p>Le ma:
Project Description

Back pain is the leading cause of disability worldwide, affecting approximately 619 million people in 2020, according to the World Health Organization. Lower back pain and restricted mobility are often symptoms of spondylosis, a set of degenerative conditions of the spine. These conditions include degeneration of the intervertebral discs and narrowing of the spinal canal (spinal stenosis), subarticular recesses, or neural foramina, which can lead to nerve compression or irritation in the lower back.

Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI) provides a detailed view of the lumbar vertebrae, discs, and nerves, allowing radiologists to assess the presence and severity of these conditions. Proper diagnosis and classification are essential to guide treatment and possible surgical interventions to alleviate back pain and improve patients' quality of life.

Context and Objective

This project is part of a competition organized by the RSNA (Radiological Society of North America) in collaboration with the American Society of Neuroradiology (ASNR). The challenge is to determine if artificial intelligence can be used to assist in the detection and classification of degenerative conditions of the lumbar spine using MRI images.

The goal is to classify five lumbar degenerative conditions:

  • Left Neural Foraminal Narrowing
  • Right Neural Foraminal Narrowing
  • Left Sub-Articular Stenosis
  • Right Sub-Articular Stenosis
  • Spinal Canal Stenosis

For each imaging study in the dataset, severity scores (Normal / Mild, Moderate, or Severe) are provided for each condition across the intervertebral disc levels L1/L2, L2/L3, L3/L4, L4/L5, and L5/S1.
<h4>Défis Techniques</h4>\n<ul>\n <li:
Technical Challenges

  • MRI Image Analysis: Develop an AI model capable of processing and classifying complex, high-resolution MRI images.
  • Multiclass Classification: Identify and classify different severity levels for multiple conditions simultaneously.
  • Diverse Data: Work with a multi-institutional, expertly curated dataset from eight sites across five continents to ensure standardized and accurate classification.

Technologies Used

  • PyTorch: For developing deep learning models.
  • OpenCV: For preprocessing MRI images.
  • Scikit-learn: For model performance evaluation and metrics.
  • Pandas and NumPy: For data manipulation and analysis.
<p>Ce projet a pour objectif de développ:
The goal of this project is to develop a neural network capable of identifying the city where a photo was taken, using a dataset of urban images from five major cities. The classification of the images is based on a dataset of 22,500 photos distributed across the following cities: Boston, London, Montreal, Paris, and Quebec.

Context and Objective

The task is to create a deep learning model capable of classifying urban images into five distinct categories corresponding to these cities. This classification is crucial for applications such as automatic location recognition, organizing large collections of urban images, or providing contextual services based on location.
<h4>Défis Techniques</h4>\n<ul>\n <li:
Technical Challenges

  • Image Variability: Images can vary significantly in terms of quality, shooting angle, and lighting conditions, which poses a challenge for model generalization.
  • Data Preprocessing: Properly processing images is essential to improve model accuracy. This includes normalization, data augmentation, and handling potential class imbalances.
  • Accuracy Evaluation: Model accuracy is evaluated based on the accuracy metric, and results must be submitted to Kaggle in CSV format.

Technologies Used

  • PyTorch: For developing the deep learning model.
  • OpenCV: For image preprocessing and data augmentation.
  • Scikit-learn: For performance evaluation and result analysis.
  • Pandas: For managing submission files and data manipulation.
<p>Ce projet consiste à développer un mo:
This project involves developing a text classification model using Recurrent Neural Networks (RNNs). The goal is to classify texts into different categories or classes based on their content, leveraging the RNNs' ability to handle sequences of data.

Context and Objective

RNNs are particularly suited for natural language processing (NLP) tasks due to their ability to capture temporal and contextual dependencies in textual data. This project aims to utilize this capability to classify texts into specific categories, which is crucial for applications such as document classification, spam detection, and sentiment analysis.
<h4>Défis Techniques</h4>\n<ul>\n <li:
Technical Challenges

  • Text Preprocessing: Texts must be cleaned and preprocessed for use in the RNN model. This includes tasks such as tokenization, stop word removal, and word vectorization.
  • Model Architecture: Designing an effective RNN architecture for text classification. This may include using variants such as Long Short-Term Memory (LSTM) or Gated Recurrent Units (GRU) to improve the model's ability to capture long-term dependencies.
  • Sequence Handling: Handling sequences of varying lengths and managing issues like vanishing or exploding gradients often encountered in traditional RNNs.

Methodology

  • Data Preprocessing: Cleaning texts, tokenization, and creating text sequences. Using techniques such as one-hot encoding or embeddings (like Word2Vec or GloVe) to convert words into numerical vectors.
  • Model Design: Developing an RNN with LSTM or GRU layers to capture sequential dependencies. Adding dense layers for final classification.
  • Training and Validation: Using techniques such as cross-validation and regularization to prevent overfitting and optimize model performance.
  • Evaluation: Measuring model performance using metrics such as precision, recall, F1-score, and accuracy.

Technologies Used

  • PyTorch: For developing and training the RNN model.
  • Numpy and Pandas: For handling text data.
  • NLTK or spaCy: For text preprocessing and NLP tools.
  • Scikit-learn: For evaluation metrics.
<p>\n Ce projet a pour but de dévelop:
This project aims to develop machine learning-based solutions for identifying threatened bird species in the Western Ghats of India from their acoustic calls. The goal is to process continuous audio data to recognize bird species by their calls, thus contributing to the conservation of avian biodiversity in this critical region.

Context

The Western Ghats, a global biodiversity hotspot located along the southwest coast of India, is home to exceptionally diverse avian fauna, including several endemic and endangered species. However, traditional large-scale avian biodiversity monitoring is costly and challenging to implement. By using passive acoustic monitoring (PAM) and machine learning-based analytical tools, it is possible to cover larger spatial areas with high temporal resolution.
<h4>Défis Techniques</h4>\n<ul>\n <li:
Technical Challenges

  • Audio Data Processing: Analyze and extract relevant features from continuous audio recordings, managing background noise and acoustic variations.
  • Species Identification: Develop models capable of accurately recognizing bird calls among numerous competing sounds, considering acoustic similarities between species.
  • Data Management: Efficiently process and store large amounts of audio data while ensuring data integrity for analysis.

Methodology

  • Data Preprocessing: Cleaning audio recordings, extracting features such as spectrograms, cepstral coefficients, and time-frequency representations.
  • Model Development: Using convolutional neural networks (CNNs) or audio signal processing models to classify bird calls into different species.
  • Training and Validation: Applying cross-validation and regularization techniques to optimize model performance and avoid overfitting.
  • Evaluation: Measuring model performance using metrics such as precision, recall, F1-score, and accuracy to ensure accurate species identification.

Technologies Used

  • PyTorch: For developing and training machine learning models.
  • Librosa: For audio data preprocessing and acoustic feature extraction.
  • Numpy and Pandas: For data manipulation and analysis.
  • Scikit-learn: For evaluation metrics and validation techniques.
<p>\n Le projet vise à dévelo:
The project aims to develop a predictive model capable of assessing the likelihood that a user will respond to a message on social media. This prediction helps anticipate interactions and optimize communication and engagement strategies on social platforms.

Context

With the rise of social media as major communication channels, it is crucial to understand and predict user responsiveness to improve the effectiveness of marketing campaigns, customer service, and overall engagement. Messages sent by businesses or individuals can vary in content, timing, and target audience, influencing the likelihood of a response.
<h4>Défis Techniques</h4>\n <ul>\:
Technical Challenges

  • Interaction Analysis: Understanding and modeling the relationship between message content, user characteristics, and the probability of response.
  • Data Processing: Handling large and heterogeneous data from social media, including messages, user metadata, and interaction histories.
  • Modeling and Prediction: Developing models capable of predicting responsiveness while considering various contextual and temporal factors.

Methodology

  • Data Collection and Preprocessing: Extracting relevant data from social media platforms, including sent messages, responses, and user characteristics. Cleaning and transforming the data to make it usable.
  • Exploratory Analysis: Exploring the data to identify variables influencing responsiveness, such as message content, timing, and user characteristics.
  • Model Development: Designing and training machine learning models, such as decision trees, random forests, or regression models, to predict the likelihood of response. Using advanced techniques like neural networks to capture complex relationships in the data.
  • Validation and Evaluation: Assessing model performance using metrics such as precision, recall, F1-score, and accuracy to measure prediction effectiveness.
  • Optimization: Tuning hyperparameters and improving preprocessing techniques to maximize prediction accuracy.

Technologies Used

  • Python: With libraries like Pandas and NumPy for data processing.
  • Scikit-learn: For machine learning algorithms.
  • TensorFlow or PyTorch: For deep learning models.
  • NLP Libraries: Such as spaCy or NLTK for text analysis and natural language processing.
<h4>Contexte</h4>\n <:
Context

NSIA Assurances is a key player in the insurance sector in Togo, with a growth ambition supported by strategic partnerships, notably with La Poste. To support its expansion, the company aims to acquire a high-performance IT tool capable of optimizing commercial management, decision support, and improving field team monitoring.

Project Objectives

The project involves developing a CRM solution that will meet the specific needs of NSIA Assurances in terms of team management, performance tracking, and data centralization. The solution must be scalable, secure, accessible, and user-friendly, while also providing interoperability with existing systems.
<h4>Technologies Utilisées :</h4>\n\n:
Technologies Used:

Frontend Web: Angular

Angular, a robust JavaScript framework, was used to develop the web interface of the CRM application. This choice allows for the creation of dynamic and responsive applications, providing a smooth and high-performance user experience. Web features include user management, commercial performance tracking, and the generation of analytical dashboards.

Mobile: Flutter

Flutter, Google's UI framework, was used to develop the mobile CRM application. With Flutter, it was possible to create a native and high-performance user interface for both iOS and Android platforms, ensuring a consistent user experience across devices. The mobile application allows salespeople to manage their activities, track their performance, and access data in real-time from their mobile devices.

Backend: Spring Boot

Spring Boot was used to design the backend microservices. This Java framework facilitates the creation of robust and scalable applications, offering a microservices-based architecture for better modularity and simplified maintenance. The microservices handle critical operations such as user management, data synchronization, and business logic.

Notification Server: Node.js

Node.js was used to develop the notification server. This choice allows for real-time notification management and ensures effective communication between different parts of the application. Notifications include alerts about new transactions, status updates, and other relevant information for users.

Key Features:

Angular Web Interface:

  • Management of salespeople and performance tracking
  • Analysis and reporting with interactive dashboards
  • Campaign and subscription management
  • Features for customer acquisition and retention management

Flutter Mobile Application:

  • Tracking schedules and daily activities of salespeople
  • Access to data and real-time updates of customer and prospect information
  • Management of interactions and notifications in the field

Backend Microservices with Spring Boot:

  • Modularity and scalability with a microservices architecture
  • Management of critical operations and user data
  • Integration with third-party services and databases

Node.js Notification Server:

  • Real-time notification management for users
  • Effective communication between different components of the application
<h3>Contexte :</h3>\n<p>\n Dans un en:
Context:

In an environment where associations play a crucial role in various communities, the effective management of their daily operations is essential to maximize their impact. These associations, often faced with administrative and organizational challenges, require a robust, flexible, and scalable technological solution. A dedicated platform for association management can centralize essential tasks such as member management, event coordination, financial management, and internal and external communication, thus improving operational efficiency and community engagement.

Project Objectives:

The primary objective of this project is to design and implement an association management platform based on a microservices architecture. This approach will provide a highly modular solution, where each core functionality of the platform (such as member management, event management, financial management, etc.) is isolated in a distinct service. This will not only facilitate the scalability of the platform to adapt to the growing or changing needs of associations but also ease maintenance by allowing updates and improvements to be made in isolation without interrupting other services.

The microservices architecture will also aim to ensure seamless interoperability with existing or future systems that associations may already use or consider adopting, thus allowing for smooth integration and progressive adoption of the platform without disrupting ongoing operations.
<h3>Principales Fonctions de la Platefor:
Main Functions of the Platform:

Member Management:

  • Registration and management of member profiles
  • Tracking of contributions and membership statuses
  • Management of groups and committees within the associations

Event Management:

  • Planning and organizing events (meetings, conferences, workshops)
  • Tracking registrations and attendance
  • Automated communication with members about events

Financial Management:

  • Tracking association revenues and expenses
  • Management of budgets and financial reports
  • Integration with online payment systems for contributions and donations

Communication and Collaboration:

  • Internal communication portal for members
  • Integration with messaging and video conferencing tools
  • Management of newsletters and email campaigns

Document Management:

  • Centralization of important documents (statutes, minutes, reports)
  • Management of access permissions and document versions
  • Archiving and easy document retrieval

Reporting and Analysis:

  • Generation of reports on activities, finances, and member participation
  • Tracking performance indicators for initiatives and events
  • Analysis tools for strategic decision-making

Microservices Architecture:

The architecture is divided into several specialized microservices, each handling a specific aspect of the platform. For example:

  • Authentication and User Management Service
  • Event Management Service
  • Financial Service
  • Communication Service
  • Document Management Service

Each microservice is independent, communicating via RESTful APIs or asynchronous messages, thus allowing horizontal scalability and increased resilience.

Technologies Used:

  • Backend: Spring Boot, Node.js, or .NET Core for microservices
  • Frontend: Angular, React, or Vue.js for the user interface
  • Database: PostgreSQL, MongoDB for data storage
  • Interservice Communication: RabbitMQ, Kafka for asynchronous exchanges
  • Containerization: Docker for packaging microservices
  • Orchestration: Kubernetes for deploying and managing microservices
  • Security: OAuth2, JWT for authorization and authentication management
<h3>Contexte</h3>\n <p>TotalEnergies:
Context

TotalEnergies Togo, a subsidiary of the multinational energy company TotalEnergies, has undertaken to equip its service stations with secure Internet access for its customers via a captive portal. This system aims to secure network access while enabling the collection of customer data and the implementation of targeted communication campaigns.

Objectives

  • Internet Access Security: Implement a robust captive portal to protect network access at TotalEnergies Togo stations.
  • Customer Data Collection: Build and manage a customer database to better understand users and personalize interactions.
  • Targeted Communication: Use the captive portal as a communication platform to execute advertising and informational campaigns for connected customers.
<h3>1. Composants Principaux</h3>\n <:
1. Main Components

  • OPNSense: Firewall and routing platform based on FreeBSD, used to manage and secure Wi-Fi connections. A custom API, developed by Id2Real, adds specific functionalities.
  • Campaign Management Web Application: Developed in Angular v12 for the frontend and Java Spring for the backend. Uses PostgreSQL as the database.

2. Security and Privacy

  • Connection Security: The captive portal ensures secure Wi-Fi access by integrating best security practices (Availability, Integrity, Confidentiality, Traceability).
  • Data Collection: Collected information is securely stored with HTTPS protocols for data protection during transmission.

3. Key Features

  • Authentication: Users agree to the terms of use, provide their contact information, and receive an identification code to access the Internet.
  • Connection Management: Returning customers automatically reconnect without re-entering their information while being redirected to TotalEnergies pages.
  • Campaign Management: Tracking and managing campaigns via the web application, allowing analysis of customer data and execution of targeted campaigns.

4. Interfaces and Integrations

  • Customer Information Recording API: Developed in Java with Spring, using PostgreSQL for data storage, accessible via HTTPS with key-based authentication.
  • SMS Sending System: Integration to send identification codes to customers via King SMS Pro.
<p>TOGOCOM, the main mobile telecommunic:
TOGOCOM, the leading mobile telecommunications operator in Togo, is dealing with a rising volume of complaints related to its facilities and equipment. To enhance the efficiency of managing these complaints and ensure rigorous tracking of interventions, the company has embarked on developing a comprehensive and integrated application.

The primary goal of the project is to provide a centralized tool for managing customer complaints, coordinating technical teams, and generating detailed reports for informed decision-making. The application aims to automate and simplify the complaint handling process while ensuring traceability and transparency of the actions taken by TOGOCOM's various teams.
<p>The complaint, installation, and equi:
The complaint, installation, and equipment management system for TOGOCOM has been designed to be a robust and scalable solution, addressing the company's needs for complaint management and technical team coordination.

Frontend

The web application has been developed in Angular, providing an intuitive and responsive user interface. It enables users to easily navigate through features such as loading and displaying complaints, registering clients and users, and printing reports.

Backend

The backend of the application has been developed using Spring Boot, ensuring a high-performance and secure architecture. This choice enables efficient handling of requests related to complaints, users, and teams, and ensures integration with databases and external services.

Mobile Application

A complementary mobile application has been developed using Flutter, allowing field teams to access essential information, update complaints in real time, and coordinate interventions directly from their mobile devices.

Key Features

Complaint Management

Users can easily record new complaints, view them in detail, and update them as they are processed. Each complaint is associated with a client and can be tracked until it is fully resolved.

Intervention Tracking

The application allows for scheduling and tracking technical interventions by field teams. Users can assign tasks to teams, record actions taken, and track progress in real time.

Client and User Management

The solution provides centralized management of clients and internal users, including client registration with detailed information, management of user access levels, and assignment of specific roles within the organization.

Team Management

The application allows for the creation and management of technical teams, assignment of interventions, and tracking of team performance. Intervention data is recorded to facilitate performance tracking and analysis.

Data Import and Export

Import features enable bulk data loading into the system, facilitating migration or integration of new information. Data export, including Excel reports, is also supported for analysis and reporting purposes.

Reports and Statistics

The application generates detailed reports on complaints, interventions, and team performance. Users can print these reports or export them for thorough review.

Printing and Documentation

All complaints, interventions, and reports can be printed directly from the application, facilitating documentation and distribution of information within the company.

Real-Time Notifications and Tracking

The system sends notifications to relevant users when a new complaint is recorded or when an intervention requires their attention. This ensures maximum responsiveness in managing complaints.

Automated Reports

An automated process via a cron job is integrated to regularly send predefined reports to users or stakeholders. This mechanism ensures automatic and timely distribution of critical information, facilitating monitoring and decision-making.
<p>The project aims to develop an innova:
The project aims to develop an innovative application dedicated to the rapid and efficient editing of notarial documents. This solution is specifically designed for notaries and legal professionals who need a reliable tool for generating, modifying, and managing legal documents in a smooth and secure manner.

Objectives

  • Process Automation: Simplify the creation and editing of notarial documents by automating recurring and repetitive tasks.
  • Legal Compliance: Ensure that all documents generated strictly adhere to current legal standards.
  • Accessibility and Security: Provide a secure and easily accessible solution for legal professionals, ensuring data protection and document integrity.
<h3>Fonctionnalités Clés</h3> <ul> <li><:
Key Features

  • Document Creation: Generation of notarial documents from predefined templates, facilitating their creation in compliance with legal requirements.
  • Editing and Personalization: Advanced tools for modifying and personalizing documents, including text editing, adding specific clauses, and customizing headers and footers.
  • Template Management: Creation, storage, and management of notarial document templates for future use, ensuring document consistency.
  • Validation and Verification: Integrated mechanisms to verify document compliance with current regulations.
  • Export and Printing: Options to export documents in PDF or Word format, with the possibility of direct printing from the application.
  • Archiving and Tracking: Management of document versions, tracking changes, and secure archiving of generated documents.
  • User Interface: Modern and user-friendly interface, developed in Angular, for smooth navigation and intuitive use.
  • Data Security: Protection of sensitive information with robust security mechanisms, including user authentication and data encryption.

Technologies Used

  • Frontend: Angular for a responsive and modern user interface.
  • Backend: Node.js for server-side process management and application logic.
  • Database: MongoDB for managing unstructured data and persisting templates and documents.
